common_issues.title: Pieces OS Connectivity Issues
common_issues.description: Users report "Connection refused" or "Route not found" errors when accessing Pieces OS on port 1000 or 39300. This might be due to port migration in version 11.0.0. Suggested solutions include verifying the port number in the config file, checking firewall settings, and ensuring Pieces OS is running. The Pieces team is aware of the issue and offers further assistance through GitHub and direct communication.

related_issues.text:
Getting Error: connect ECONNREFUSED 127.0.0.1:1000
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I tried to include the Pieces OS endpoint (127.0.0.1:1000) into my external project, but even though Pieces OS is operating, I keep getting the error "Connection refused."

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f50f1e1d-4eb2-46a2-9df7-2892ea6d319b)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation
**Key Points Raised:**

* Raju-git20 reported an issue with Pieces not working after the 11.0.0 update.
* Mark-at-pieces responded that the Pieces port was migrated to 39300 in the new version.
* Raju-git20 confirmed trying the new port but still encountered issues.
* Mark-at-pieces clarified that POS uses a range of ports and provided additional information about port-finding algorithms.
* Raju-git20 explained that they are building a Python code for LinkedIn position scraping and application.
* Mark-at-pieces offered to schedule a call to discuss the project and provide feedback.

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces wasn't working after the 11.0.0 update due to the port migration.
* The port-finding algorithm wasn't working correctly for Raju-git20's setup.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark-at-pieces provided the new port number (39300) and explained the port-finding algorithm.
* Mark-at-pieces offered to schedule a call to discuss Raju-git20's project and provide further assistance.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Raju-git20 is scheduled to have a call with Mark-at-pieces to discuss the project and potential solutions.
* The issue remains unresolved pending the call and further troubleshooting.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS High Resource Usage and Crashes
common_issues.description: Users report high RAM/CPU usage by PiecesOS, sometimes exceeding 2GB RAM and 50% CPU. This causes system slowdowns and crashes. Proposed solutions include restarting PiecesOS, upgrading to the latest version (11.1.0), and disabling the Live Context feature. The Pieces team is actively investigating and resolving these issues.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
Several users have called in recently about Pieces using too much RAM or causing a spike in CPU up to 100%. We are trying to track down this issue, and would appreciate any feedback about your experience with this if you are experiencing it. 

We have a hunch it has something to do with internet connections, but aren't fully sure yet. 

If you're experiencing this and wouldn't mind hopping on a call with us to show us, we would really appreciate it to help us troubleshoot! You can schedule a call [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/0/appointments/schedules/AcZssZ2iaRWpd1kA2k_xg2KrVi_jiTHo0POiMZSI9WAYsxs5jJ9sU2Rd2zKitLuSFd7l3FhatGzy5Vgt
). 

A short-term solution is to restart PiecesOS whenever this occurs. 
## Summary of GitHub Issue #676: PiecesOS High RAM and CPU Usage

**Key Points Raised:**

* Several users reported high RAM and CPU usage by PiecesOS, particularly when running in the background or with the Live Context feature enabled.
* Some users reported usage exceeding 2GB of RAM and 50% CPU, causing system slowdowns.

**Problems Identified:**

* High memory and CPU usage, negatively impacting user experience.
* Potential memory leak causing excessive RAM usage.
* Live Context feature contributing to increased resource consumption.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Replacing heavy database technologies in PiecesOS 11.1.0 to address memory and CPU issues.
* Adding "Optimize Memory" option to unload unused ML models and free up RAM.
* Investigating further optimizations for future releases.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* PiecesOS 11.1.0 released with database technology replacement to address resource usage.
* Users encouraged to upgrade and report feedback on improvements.
* Ongoing development of further optimizations for resource efficiency.

**Additional Notes:**

* Live Context feature can be disabled to reduce resource consumption if needed.
* Users experiencing excessive usage beyond 2GB of RAM are encouraged to contact Pieces for troubleshooting.

related_issues.title: Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
related_issues.text:
Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

User reports immediate "Ollama failed to install" diaglog upon clicking install Ollama install button in Pieces desktop app
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* Package issue preventing Ollama installation due to curl missing in sandboxed environment.
* Ollama not found, even when manually installed, due to sandbox limitations.
* Fix planned to enable Ollama usage within the sandbox.

**Problems:**

* Ollama cannot be downloaded and installed due to missing `curl`.
* Manually installed Ollama is not recognized due to sandbox limitations.

**Proposed Solutions:**

* Add `curl` to the list of dependency packages in the snap definition file.
* Enable Ollama usage from within the sandbox.

**Current Status:**

* A fix is in progress and expected to be released soon.

**Outcome:**

* Once available, the fix will allow Pieces to successfully download and use Ollama within the sandbox environment.
